intro: Silaum perfoliatum, commonly known as common siliquaria, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the familyApiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, hollow stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant produces small, oval fruits that are often used in traditional medicine. Its leaves are alternate and have a distinctive, slightly hairy texture. Silaum perfoliatum is often found growing in disturbed soils and along roadsides.
